subject: labs: wait for namespaces and interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-19 13:08:23.000000000', 'files': ['labs/scripts/setup_neutron_network.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/training-guides/commit/6045d3c2fd7988b54971f02c14cdc6364f186fc8', 'message': 'labs: wait for namespaces and interfaces

When setting up neutron router and DHCP, the time until namespaces and
interfaces are ready varies a lot (from less than a second to five
seconds and more), even on the same host system. If it takes longer, we
proceed too early which leaves the cluster misconfigured. In that case,
nova instances fail to get a DHCP address.

This patch makes sure the script waits until the interfaces are ready.

Change-Id: I346a098062d984956cf496e89f9ada2a38df0569
'}]
commit_message:
labs: wait for namespaces and interfaces

When setting up neutron router and DHCP, the time until namespaces and
interfaces are ready varies a lot (from less than a second to five
seconds and more), even on the same host system. If it takes longer, we
proceed too early which leaves the cluster misconfigured. In that case,
nova instances fail to get a DHCP address.

This patch makes sure the script waits until the interfaces are ready.

Change-Id: I346a098062d984956cf496e89f9ada2a38df0569
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/25/122725/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo -n "Getting router namespace." nsrouter=$(ip netns|grep qrouter) while [ : ]; do nsrouter=$(ip netns|grep qrouter) if [ -n "$nsrouter" ]; then echo echo "Router namespace: $nsrouter" break fi echo -n "." sleep 1 done echo -n "Getting DHCP namespace." while [ : ]; do nsdhcp=$(ip netns|grep qdhcp) if [ -n "$nsdhcp" ]; then echo echo "DHCP namespace: $nsdhcp" break fi echo -n "." sleep 1 done echo -n "Waiting for interfaces qr-*, qg-* in router namespace." while [ : ]; do ifaces=$(sudo ip netns exec "$nsrouter" ip addr) if [[ $ifaces == *:\ qr-* && $ifaces == *:\ qg-* ]]; then echo break fi echo -n "." sleep 1 done echo -n "Waiting for interface tap* in DHCP namespace." while [ : ]; do ifaces=$(sudo ip netns exec "$nsdhcp" ip addr) if [[ $ifaces == *:\ tap* ]]; then echo break fi echo -n "." sleep 1 done

subject: Non-EUI64 fixed IPs should be rejected for IPv6 SLAAC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-16 11:17:12.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/ef584ccc278b3f0555a819d0782bfc07e508a53a', 'message': "Non-EUI64 fixed IPs should be rejected for IPv6 SLAAC

When a port is created on a subnet that is configured for IPv6 SLAAC,
that port's IP address will be automatically generated (to a
pre-determined value, based on the subnet's IPv6 prefix and the port's
MAC address) using the EUI64 address algorithm. Therefore, any port
create request that includes a fixed IPv6 address that does not match
the expected IPv6 EUI64 address should be rejected.

This change adds a check for any fixed IP addresses that do not match
the expected automatically-generated addresses for port creation on
an IPv6 SLAAC subnet.

This change also removes a check for duplicate address assignment on
IPv6 SLAAC subnets. Duplicate address assignments on IPv6 SLAAC should
be prevented by the following:
- IPv6 prefixes are confirmed to be unique when the subnet is created.
- MAC addresses are confirmed to be unique when a port is created.
- This new change will only allow unique EUI64 addresses (based on
  unique prefix and unique MAC address) to get assigned to a port
  on an IPv6 SLAAC subnet.
(I tried leaving in the existing check for duplicate addresses on
IPv6 SLAAC subnets, but was at a loss as to how to modify the existing
associated unit test to force duplicate addresses, because of the
considerations listed above.)

Change-Id: I986abbad89fe003bbd34804b5143791865607494
Closes-Bug: #1369767
"}]
commit_message:
Non-EUI64 fixed IPs should be rejected for IPv6 SLAAC

When a port is created on a subnet that is configured for IPv6 SLAAC,
that port's IP address will be automatically generated (to a
pre-determined value, based on the subnet's IPv6 prefix and the port's
MAC address) using the EUI64 address algorithm. Therefore, any port
create request that includes a fixed IPv6 address that does not match
the expected IPv6 EUI64 address should be rejected.

This change adds a check for any fixed IP addresses that do not match
the expected automatically-generated addresses for port creation on
an IPv6 SLAAC subnet.

This change also removes a check for duplicate address assignment on
IPv6 SLAAC subnets. Duplicate address assignments on IPv6 SLAAC should
be prevented by the following:
- IPv6 prefixes are confirmed to be unique when the subnet is created.
- MAC addresses are confirmed to be unique when a port is created.
- This new change will only allow unique EUI64 addresses (based on
  unique prefix and unique MAC address) to get assigned to a port
  on an IPv6 SLAAC subnet.
(I tried leaving in the existing check for duplicate addresses on
IPv6 SLAAC subnets, but was at a loss as to how to modify the existing
associated unit test to force duplicate addresses, because of the
considerations listed above.)

Change-Id: I986abbad89fe003bbd34804b5143791865607494
Closes-Bug: #1369767

commit_message:
Do not cache auth token in Neutron DHCP provider

Currently token expire after some time and deploy breaks.
Also refactored all tests for Neutron DHCP provider, as
many of them were just broken (e.g. using non-existing asserts).

Change-Id: I38a8e95a09fd4737682e37b1162eb445fbc8012f
Closes-Bug: #1371503

commit_message:
Fixes 'Same hostname for different instances' bug

Classes that inherit from NetworkManager use the attribute instance_dns_manager
to handle DNS service operations. This attribute is an instance of the class
defined at CONF.instance_dns_manager, that is, by default,
'nova.network.noop_dns_driver.NoopDNSDriver'. Changing the default driver to
'nova.network.minidns.MiniDNS' implies in verifying if a DNS entry name is
unique into the domain before adding the new DNS entry.

DocImpact Any documentation considering NoopDNSDriver as default DNS driver have
to be updated.
UpgradeImpact Existing OpenStack setups in whose there are existing different
instances with the same hostname may be affected when introducing this patch.
Existing instances may be affected by any operation that need to reconfigure
networking on the instance, such as re-sizing or migrating.

Closes-Bug: #1283538

Change-Id: I2fdd8296431b3011b408759ccc63ba136e2f2b16

commit_message:
Fix test not passing due to Nova patch

The test test_create_with_existing_server_name at
tempest/api/compute/servers/test_servers.py is not passing due to
the patch for the bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1283538.
This patch prevents the creation of different instances with the
same hostname into the same domain.
For further information, look at the Nova patch review at
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/94252/

Change-Id: I2278a5326c64633dc7afe043c1fc87abb8801f33

commit_message:
labs: set lower MTU for bridge to instance VM

The MTU on the bridge to the instance VMs needs to be lower than 1500 to
compensate for the GRE overhead. With an MTU of 1500, one thing that
fails is ssh authentication (into the instance VM).

This patch does not help for the CirrOS 0.3.2 image which we currently
use, because it is not able to pick up MTU values via DHCP.

Change-Id: I2a04b62beef6120e811f00472aa7395ab3d683dc
Co-Authored-By: Pranav Salunke <dguitarbite@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/08/123008/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset_sudo $conf DEFAULT dnsmasq_config_file /etc/neutron/dnsmasq-neutron.conf cat << DNSMASQ | sudo tee /etc/neutron/dnsmasq-neutron.conf # Using DHCP option to set interface MTU to 1454 (for instance, ssh # authentication may fail otherwise due to GRE overhead) dhcp-option-force=26,1454 DNSMASQ killall dnsmasq

labs: split get_base_disk_path

Spin off get_base_disk_name from get_base_disk_path so we can get the
disk name without the directory.

Change-Id: Id813fd9bbf8a859b639f92a380c067dfc67a95c7

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:20:51.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs/commit/d840624af351fba13d6e596ecc01bdc7af3dfe79', 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/barbican-specs refs/changes/91/121291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Ported repository installation from puppet-openstack

Ported repository installation from puppet-openstack. Added
error handling for invalid repositories. Using stahnma/epel
to manage EPEL installation EPEL 7. Set repository default
to 'icehouse'.

Change-Id: I6fdbaf1ee59186aba4d2d5945c9297fb5ef94cbb

added_lines: # Ubuntu Cloud Archive Repository # # === parameters # # [*release*] # The OpenStack release. Supported options are # 'folsom', 'grizzly', 'havana', and 'icehouse'. # Default is 'icehouse'. # # [*repo*] # The UCS repository to pull from. Current supported # options are 'proposed' and 'updates'. # Default is 'updates'. # class openstack_extras::repo::uca( $release = 'icehouse', $repo = 'updates' ) { $supported_releases = ['folsom', 'grizzly', 'havana', 'icehouse'] if member($supported_releases, $release) { if ($::operatingsystem == 'Ubuntu' and $::lsbdistdescription =~ /^.*LTS.*$/) { include apt::update apt::source { 'ubuntu-cloud-archive': location => 'http://ubuntu-cloud.archive.canonical.com/ubuntu', release => "${::lsbdistcodename}-${repo}/${release}", repos => 'main', required_packages => 'ubuntu-cloud-keyring', } Exec['apt_update'] -> Package<||> } } else { fail("${release} is not a supported UCA release. Options are ${supported_releases}.") } }

commit_message:
labs: fix shared folder restore after export

Fix the code responsible for reattaching shared directories after VMs
have been exported.

For OVA export:
- use saved share names instead of default name (for the sake of
  correctness; it is unlikely that a user will change the name)

For dir export:
- save and reattach shared directories after export

Change-Id: I79162c1ec788aa1d89104aa92aebeae2bb05adf5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/training-guides refs/changes/63/122963/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: vm_add_share "$node" "${share_paths[$ii]}" "$SHARE_NAME" local share_path=$(vm_get_share_path "$node") if [ -n "$share_path" ]; then echo >&2 "Removing shared folder for export" vm_rm_share "$node" "$SHARE_NAME" fi if [ -n "$share_path" ]; then echo >&2 "Reattaching shared folder" vm_add_share "$node" "$share_path" "$SHARE_NAME" fi

commit_message:
Disable the RPC tests

We are going to be removing the RPC tests shortly, and the versions in
the incubator have some known concurrency issues that have been fixed in
oslo.messaging. Disable the tests here until we are ready to branch and
remove all of the RPC code entirely.

Change-Id: I385219025ea9d456c8d21e4ec6960c80bdbd1721

subject: Fixes AttributeError with api sample test fail
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-11 02:09:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/integrated/api_samples_test_base.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/d7fa7ffe696ad40e25ce555ed9b017a6441817b5', 'message': 'Fixes AttributeError with api sample test fail

Avoid AttributeError which could be raised with api sample tests
when a string is expected but a non string type is returned
instead. This makes debugging api sample test failures easier as

rather than an AttributeError exception.

Change-Id: I4d124e4d80779c4431926619f0ca876a513a8462

commit_message:
Fixes AttributeError with api sample test fail

Avoid AttributeError which could be raised with api sample tests
when a string is expected but a non string type is returned
instead. This makes debugging api sample test failures easier as
the expected and actual values are displayed in the error message
rather than an AttributeError exception.

Change-Id: I4d124e4d80779c4431926619f0ca876a513a8462
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/73/120673/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if isinstance(result, six.string_types): result = result.strip()

subject: Access correct key for template name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-12 18:37:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/6bb956f1d450adae56390dae317461aba20314b9', 'message': 'Access correct key for template name

When an exception occurs loading the config agent driver, the handler
tries to log a message and accesses the wrong key to get the template
name. This causes another exception, and masks the original exception.
Simple correction to access the right key, and does the logging inside
the with block so context of exception is not lost.

Change-Id: I3991bc4c509bbd8d68f7a1c8c8314404f2e0eafa
Closes-Bug: #1368900
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-16 10:56:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/cisco/cfg_agent/device_drivers/driver_mgr.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/a2ef082cb0b25d14595a8810adb16df3f9661e43', 'message': 'Access correct key for template name

When an exception occurs while loading the config agent driver, the
handler tries to log a message, but accesses the wrong key to get the
template name. This causes another exception, which masks the original
exception.

This change accesses the correct key and performs logging inside a
with block to (defensively) preserve the exception context.

Change-Id: I3991bc4c509bbd8d68f7a1c8c8314404f2e0eafa
Closes-Bug: #1368900
'}]
commit_message:
Access correct key for template name

When an exception occurs while loading the config agent driver, the
handler tries to log a message, but accesses the wrong key to get the
template name. This causes another exception, which masks the original
exception.

This change accesses the correct key and performs logging inside a
with block to (defensively) preserve the exception context.

Change-Id: I3991bc4c509bbd8d68f7a1c8c8314404f2e0eafa
Closes-Bug: #1368900
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/97/121197/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(reraise=False): LOG.exception(_("Error loading cfg agent driver %(driver)s " "for hosting device template " "%(t_name)s(%(t_id)s)"), {'driver': driver_class, 't_id': hd_id, 't_name': resource['name']})

Use $::processorcount to compute API workers number

As we do in other OpenStack Puppet modules, let's use $::processorcount
fact to compute the number of API workers and improve scalability for
cinder-api service.

commit_message:
Add hidden option testmode=yes to kernel args

testmode will prevent Fuel Master from
deploying. It can be used to make changes
prior to Puppet deployment.

commit_message:
Fix wrong inheritance for class HeatBaseTest

Sometimes the Sahara Platform test fails without any messages.
This bug occurs when we run Heat and Sahara Platform tests together.
If we run the Sahara test only, everything will be OK. The problem is
in wrong inheritance for class HeatBaseTest in heatmanager.py.

Change-Id: I88c4100d3603cffc4f353386490802fc6f6953b7
Closes-Bug: #1367743

commit_message:
add_node_capability and rm_node_capability unable to save changes to db

Changes to elements in existing node.properties dictionary will not get
saved to database by node.save(context) method. The properties dictionary
needs to be replaced by a new one to get the changes to be saved in the db.

Change-Id: I3bb65d00e141aedcb1278c1a700d12c9b29f7232
Closes-bug:#1371816

commit_message:
Don't convert numeric protocol values to int

They are treated as strings everywhere. Converting them to int causes problems
when using postgresql as the database backend because it doesn't automatically
cast them back to integer.

Change-Id: I9f0a5149d24a4c003409728e50376569c97e7325
Closes-bug: 1330490
(cherry picked from commit 3be62f878e8165cf3bce357a00b8a583773f7d3b)

commit_message:
Check if cinder services are enabled before starting them

In a multi-node setup it is not possible to only use c-vol because
it will be tried to also start c-api, c-sch and c-bak, which will
fail.

Change-Id: Ide64d3c6b8580ce5f62ff5f17b47f37f72e9aa44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/43/122943/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_service_enabled c-api; then run_process c-api "$CINDER_BIN_DIR/cinder-api --config-file $CINDER_CONF" echo "Waiting for Cinder API to start..." if ! wait_for_service $SERVICE_TIMEOUT $CINDER_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$CINDER_SERVICE_HOST:$CINDER_SERVICE_PORT; then die $LINENO "c-api did not start" fi if is_service_enabled c-sch; then run_process c-sch "$CINDER_BIN_DIR/cinder-scheduler --config-file $CINDER_CONF" fi if is_service_enabled c-bak; then run_process c-bak "$CINDER_BIN_DIR/cinder-backup --config-file $CINDER_CONF" fi if is_service_enabled c-vol; then run_process c-vol "$CINDER_BIN_DIR/cinder-volume --config-file $CINDER_CONF" fi
deleted_lines: run_process c-api "$CINDER_BIN_DIR/cinder-api --config-file $CINDER_CONF" echo "Waiting for Cinder API to start..." if ! wait_for_service $SERVICE_TIMEOUT $CINDER_SERVICE_PROTOCOL://$CINDER_SERVICE_HOST:$CINDER_SERVICE_PORT; then die $LINENO "c-api did not start" run_process c-sch "$CINDER_BIN_DIR/cinder-scheduler --config-file $CINDER_CONF" run_process c-bak "$CINDER_BIN_DIR/cinder-backup --config-file $CINDER_CONF" run_process c-vol "$CINDER_BIN_DIR/cinder-volume --config-file $CINDER_CONF"

subject: Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-31 15:25:25.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_hp3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/san/hp/hp_3par_common.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/997328c27d06a0e5d7af40cf39db1d60d122c7f8', 'message': 'Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR

Nova bypasses the cinder checks for a volume
being available, when it tries to attach a volume
to a new host during live migration.  The assumption
in cinder to this point has been that volumes can only
be attached to one host.  The 3PAR driver worked under
that assumption.  This assumption fell apart during detach
time as the driver was only looking for a VLUN on the
entire 3PAR, since it assumed it could only exist on one host.

This patch ensures that the driver looks for the VLUN on the
hostname it expects.

Closes-Bug: 1288927
(cherry picked from commit 2c1701e2f50feb5fa25ea6fb1b620f39346779de)
Cherry-pick: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/78736/11

'}]
commit_message:
Fixed nova VM live migration issue with 3PAR

Nova bypasses the cinder checks for a volume
being available, when it tries to attach a volume
to a new host during live migration.  The assumption
in cinder to this point has been that volumes can only
be attached to one host.  The 3PAR driver worked under
that assumption.  This assumption fell apart during detach
time as the driver was only looking for a VLUN on the
entire 3PAR, since it assumed it could only exist on one host.

This patch ensures that the driver looks for the VLUN on the
hostname it expects.

Closes-Bug: 1288927
(cherry picked from commit 2c1701e2f50feb5fa25ea6fb1b620f39346779de)
Cherry-pick: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/78736/11

Change-Id: I9f0044f8f1965624f1683045e18d8e4df1ce2272
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/52/84152/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 1.2.3 - Fix detach issue for multiple host bug #1288927 VERSION = "1.2.3" VLUN_TYPE_MATCHED_SET = 4 def _get_vlun(self, volume_name, hostname): """find a VLUN on a 3PAR host.""" vluns = self.client.getHostVLUNs(hostname) found_vlun = None for vlun in vluns: if volume_name in vlun['volumeName']: found_vlun = vlun break msg = (_("3PAR vlun %(name)s not found on host %(host)s") % {'name': volume_name, 'host': hostname}) if found_vlun is None: LOG.warn(msg) return found_vlun return self._get_vlun(volume_name, host['name']) vlun = self._get_vlun(volume_name, hostname) if vlun is not None: # VLUN Type of MATCHED_SET 4 requires the port to be provided if self.VLUN_TYPE_MATCHED_SET == vlun['type']: self.client.deleteVLUN(volume_name, vlun['lun'], hostname, vlun['portPos']) else: self.client.deleteVLUN(volume_name, vlun['lun'], hostname)
deleted_lines: VERSION = "1.2.2" return self.client.getVLUN(volume_name) vlun = self.client.getVLUN(volume_name) self.client.deleteVLUN(volume_name, vlun['lun'], hostname)

commit_message:
Change endpoint_type parameter

Replace endpoint_type parameter by os_endpoint_type parameter
expected by ceilometerclient.

Cherry-picked from d6639d849f69582bac0fdc337f8955ed92d38101
Closes-Bug: #1257232

Conflicts:
	tests/alarm/evaluator/test_threshold.py

Change-Id: I676247b289f8efa7c047a34dc9333361d094b024
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ceilometer refs/changes/06/66006/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_singleton_endpoint_types(self): endpoint_types = ["internalURL", "publicURL"] for endpoint_type in endpoint_types: cfg.CONF.set_override('os_endpoint_type', endpoint_type, group='service_credentials') with mock.patch('ceilometerclient.client.get_client') as client: self.singleton.api_client = None self.singleton._evaluate_assigned_alarms() conf = cfg.CONF.service_credentials expected = [mock.call(2, os_auth_url=conf.os_auth_url, os_region_name=conf.os_region_name, os_tenant_name=conf.os_tenant_name, os_password=conf.os_password, os_username=conf.os_username, cacert=conf.os_cacert, os_endpoint_type=conf.os_endpoint_type)] actual = client.call_args_list self.assertEqual(actual, expected)

subject: Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-05-12 17:57:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/0c58f45b10ddb2e6e2026b4250b5aca5f66fc5e5', 'message': 'Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces
Backport from icehouse (60cb0911712ad11688b4d09e5c01ac39c49f5aea)
Closes-Bug: 1240849
Original fix by:
Yves-Gwenael Bourhis <yves-gwenael.bourhis@cloudwatt.com>
Original fix description:
Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Notes about fix backport:
Icehouse renamed update_port() to scan_port() and added conception of 'updated'
ports. Original fix adding ports check_changed_vlan() found changed, but
in havana there is no 'updated' ports.

Hopefully, icehouse threaded updated ports as added in process_network_ports(),
so idea of backport is that if we add changed ports to 'added', havana's version
of process_network_ports() will do same, as icehouse's version.

Hope it will works.

Change-Id: I0bfd980019fed5754bd9e00c9d3fe2d909bf89d4

commit_message:
Fixing lost vlan ids on interfaces

Sometimes a vm gets its tap interface unset and reset too fast to be caught in
an agent loop, and its vlan tag was not reset.

We now detect if an interface loses its vlan tag, and if it happens the
interface will be reconfigured.

Since the TAG ID is only available via the "Port" table (in the 'tag' column),
we couldn't reuse the get_vif_port_set() method's run_vsctl call which queries
the "Interface" table, and needed a specific run_vsct call to the "Port" table
in the new get_port_tag_dict() method.

Change-Id: I0bfd980019fed5754bd9e00c9d3fe2d909bf89d4
Closes-Bug: 1240849
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/43/93343/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # adopting changes from 60cb0911712 (bug #1240849) # havana has no idea about 'updated' ports, we will add updated ports to 'added'. # In icehouse process_network_ports() join updated to added, so if we add # updated ports to added it should helps. updated_ports = set(self.check_changed_vlans(registered_ports)) if ports == registered_ports and not updated_ports: added = ports - registered_ports + updated_ports def check_changed_vlans(self, registered_ports): """Return ports which have lost their vlan tag. The returned value is a set of port ids of the ports concerned by a vlan tag loss. """ port_tags = self.int_br.get_port_tag_dict() changed_ports = set() for lvm in self.local_vlan_map.values(): for port in registered_ports: if ( port in lvm.vif_ports and lvm.vif_ports[port].port_name in port_tags and port_tags[lvm.vif_ports[port].port_name] != lvm.vlan ): LOG.info( _("Port '%(port_name)s' has lost " "its vlan tag '%(vlan_tag)d'!"), {'port_name': lvm.vif_ports[port].port_name, 'vlan_tag': lvm.vlan} ) changed_ports.add(port) return changed_ports
deleted_lines: if ports == registered_ports: added = ports - registered_ports

commit_message:
Show all custom properties on image detail page

Display all custom properties of a given image on the Image Detail
page. Titles for the custom properties can optionally be displayed
if they are defined in IMAGE_CUSTOM_PROPERTY_TITLES in local
settings.

(cherry picked from commit def80bef83c579114e16a0eae139ce7c1a28cecb)

Conflicts:
	openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images_and_snapshots/images/tabs.py

Change-Id: If97dd4a37c40d1edbc2264e298e70b14545f1dc2
Closes-Bug: #1249543
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/25/92925/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # The IMAGE_CUSTOM_PROPERTY_TITLES settings is used to customize the titles for # image custom property attributes that appear on image detail pages. IMAGE_CUSTOM_PROPERTY_TITLES = { "architecture": _("Architecture"), "kernel_id": _("Kernel ID"), "ramdisk_id": _("Ramdisk ID"), "image_state": _("Euca2ools state"), "project_id": _("Project ID"), "image_type": _("Image Type") }

subject: Don't detach root device volume
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-25 02:33:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/306b008070e2e4acec3835f26ce1f0e93efcacea', 'message': "Don't detach root device volume

Detach a root device volume may cause various guest error. Although
we can argue that it's user response to not detach the root device
volume, a check in nova will be more helpful.

We can either give a warning message, or not allow it. This patch
forbids this operation, considering that even in real system, remove
root device does not make much sense.

Closes-Bug: #1279300

Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7fbb42296970ee30d21bbd66b144a2ab421aa17f)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_volumes.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_extended_volumes.py

Change-Id: I01f086be668b35442a2f139f4d7dc96884a3bda6

commit_message:
Don't detach root device volume

Detach a root device volume may cause various guest error. Although
we can argue that it's user response to not detach the root device
volume, a check in nova will be more helpful.

We can either give a warning message, or not allow it. This patch
forbids this operation, considering that even in real system, remove
root device does not make much sense.

Closes-Bug: #1279300

Signed-off-by: Yunhong Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7fbb42296970ee30d21bbd66b144a2ab421aa17f)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_volumes.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_extended_volumes.py

Change-Id: I01f086be668b35442a2f139f4d7dc96884a3bda6

commit_message:
Fix broken API os-migrations

The return is not what we are expecting:
  migration-list: 'unicode' object has no attribute 'iteritems'

The conversion of the object nova.objects.MigrationList into a list
is not applied automatically.

Closes-Bug: #1260249
(cherry picked from commit 4963fa0fa0d96d8641339614438d42c81958f728)

	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/migrations.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_migrations.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_migrations.py

commit_message:
Delete iSCSI devices after volume detached

Previously, after detaching from a volume, the iSCSI device
remains attached on the compute node until all LUNs for a given
IQN are detached -- causing issues when LUNs are reused for
different volumes. This change will delete the device(s)
associated with the detached volume so LUNs can be reused.

Conflicts:

	nova/virt/libvirt/volume.py

Fixes bug 1112483
Change-Id: Icae3ec4d1ee2036fbba7b9eb5c03a1c86014fcc0
(cherry picked from commit 8a6ee4808782820cc0938519eb3db63a5eb9a2ff)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-28 08:54:40.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/c32b527f0b45b774603d33ccaa243d49093404e7', 'message': 'Remove second get call to list/show volumes

Recently it was observed that with large numbers of volumes
that things like "cinder list" could take extremely long to
return.

For example, running cinder list on a system with 1000 volumes took
greater than 30 seconds to return.  It turns out that the cause of
this is the addition of visible admin_metadata.

There's two problems with this:
1. The original patch probably shouldn't have gone in
   data is either admin data or it's not, selectively picking
   pieces of admin data out to provide to the user just creates
   complications and introduces confusion.
2. The REAL issue here is that since the standar gets are made
   with the standard user context, the add_visible_admin_metadata
   would go through and do an elevated context get on every single
   volume individually.  This is what caused the horrible performance
   issue on cinder list with large numbers of volumes.

Running as admin, or removing the second call drops this down to about 3
seconds for the same 1000 volume list.

This patch removes the secondary admin context get_call.  Instead where
we expect to do display the visible admin_meta, we pass in a flag
requesting that the volume object we're getting has the appropriate
metadata.  This way we can elevate the context if needed and avoid
iterating through the gets again.

This patch also cleans up the get_visible_admin_meta methods, and
consolidates both V1 and V2 to use the utils method.

commit_message:
Remove second get call to list/show volumes

Recently it was observed that with large numbers of volumes
that things like "cinder list" could take extremely long to
return.

For example, running cinder list on a system with 1000 volumes took
greater than 30 seconds to return.  It turns out that the cause of
this is the addition of visible admin_metadata.

There's two problems with this:
1. The original patch probably shouldn't have gone in
   data is either admin data or it's not, selectively picking
   pieces of admin data out to provide to the user just creates
   complications and introduces confusion.
2. The REAL issue here is that since the standar gets are made
   with the standard user context, the add_visible_admin_metadata
   would go through and do an elevated context get on every single
   volume individually.  This is what caused the horrible performance
   issue on cinder list with large numbers of volumes.

Running as admin, or removing the second call drops this down to about 3
seconds for the same 1000 volume list.

This patch removes the secondary admin context get_call.  Instead where
we expect to do display the visible admin_meta, we pass in a flag
requesting that the volume object we're getting has the appropriate
metadata.  This way we can elevate the context if needed and avoid
iterating through the gets again.

This patch also cleans up the get_visible_admin_meta methods, and
consolidates both V1 and V2 to use the utils method.

Closes-Bug: 1317606

Conflicts:
	cinder/api/contrib/volume_manage.py
	cinder/api/v1/volumes.py
	cinder/api/v2/volumes.py
	cinder/tests/api/v1/test_volumes.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/stubs.py
	cinder/tests/api/v2/test_volumes.py
	cinder/volume/api.py

Change-Id: I3fb7aefb7d8a5664b0a3fb3958f509b5cd621320
(cherry picked from commit 0505bb268942534ad5d6ecd5e34a4d9b0e7f5c04)

commit_message:
Proper port for LBaaS members

This patch set makes loadbalancer select a port on pool subnet
for new members if possible.

Conflicts:
        openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/tests.py
        openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/loadbalancers/workflows.py

Closes-Bug: #1288859

commit_message:
Fix glance api v2 create empty image scenario

Currently, when user call glance api v2 to create an empty image,
then the image.size pollster will get an image with size=None, and
that sampe will be stored in database, then when we call
v2/samples/image.size, the wsme.exc.MissingArgument will be raised.

We should check the image.size when yield samples.

Change-Id: I4e5124cdac03eda0154d437777b17349985f067d
Closes-Bug: #1304678

commit_message:
Make sure that gateway is in CIDR range by default

Git commit c3706fa2 introduced the force_gateway_on_subnet
option that verified that the defined gateway is in the CIDR
range of a newly created or updated subnet. However, the default
value was False for backwards compatability reasons. The default
will change to True and the option will be marked as deprecated.

For IPv6, the gateway must be in the CIDR only if the gateway
is not a link local address.

Conflicts:
        neutron/common/config.py
        neutron/tests/unit/ml2/test_ml2_plugin.py
        neutron/tests/unit/nuage/test_nuage_plugin.py
        neutron/tests/unit/oneconvergence/test_nvsd_plugin.py
        neutron/tests/unit/test_db_plugin.py

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1304181

commit_message:
Fix parameter checking about quota update api

In quota_classes and quotas update API, parameters are checked
whether they are integer or not.
But when pass float values to these APIs, error doesn't occur.
Float values should be forbidden for the following reasons.
(1)If the value that user submitted and the value registered
   actually are different, user will be confused.
(2)Error messages of these APIs are "...must be integer...".
(3)In horizon, if a float is submitted, error message is displayed.

This patch fixes this problem.

Closes-Bug: #1243037
(cherry picked from commit 01e1c027754b47239b9f9a6c40196512ec262986)

Conflicts:
	nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/quota_classes.py
	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/quota_classes.py
	nova/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/quota_sets.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_quota_classes.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_quota_sets.py

Change-Id: I4c7df52ffff2d997da4e6267e25ec2ea4ab6f153

commit_message:
Add Bigswitch plugin in migration that creates 'agents' table

For creating table 'networkdhcpagentbindings' table 'agents' is
needed to exist, but Bigswitch plugin was not added to the
migration_for_plugins list in migration 511471cc46b_agent_ext_model_supp.

Closes-Bug: #1337216

Change-Id: I42de075505777951918b50ce04077ca890f77418

commit_message:
Fix service API and cells

The move to the object model broke the service API when used together
with cells. The underlying problem is how cells will overload the id
field with a cell path to uniquely identify each service in each cell.

Changing the id to a string would defeat the purpose of the object model
so this patch uses a proxy to modify the id on access to make the
difference transparent to the API.

Closes-bug: 1251043
(cherry picked from commit 0df94733f7283cbc1e9ae7d27f5cd443158cae8e)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/contrib/test_services.py
	nova/tests/api/openstack/compute/plugins/v3/test_services.py

Change-Id: I165b5d64b0c1556511eb02d179ca9fc6f101c008

commit_message:
fix memory leak for _safe_log

In _safe_log it use recursive closure. The gc can not free stack for
those recursive closure for cycle-reference. So cut down the cycle
to fix it.

Change-Id: I3bd48e16fb2efd23674b7346168ad1a147019b89

commit_message:
Add host_routes property to Neutron subnet resource

Template snippet that was functionally tested:

subnet:
  Type: OS::Neutron::Subnet
  Properties:
    host_routes:
    - {destination: 192.168.1.0/24, nexthop: 192.168.1.2}
    network_id: {Ref: network}
    ip_version: 4
    cidr: 10.0.3.0/24
    allocation_pools:
    - {end: 10.0.3.150, start: 10.0.3.20}

(Next hop probably would make more sense to be in the CIDR)

Change-Id: I36f72f006a1ba48a6ed55a1c361b3df8d1359caa
Closes-Bug: #1250710
Co-Authored-By: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

subject: Fail if non-existent security group referenced
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-19 15:38:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/3e32a3ed3bb609cf477323c8349b6c8530e87d88', 'message': 'Fail if non-existent security group referenced

When using AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resources with nova-network (not
Neutron), if a SourceSecurityGroupName was specified in a rule but the
name did not correspond to an extant security group it would be silently
ignored. This change ensures that any such error in the template will cause
creation of the security group to fail.

Fixes-bug: #1291091

Change-Id: I9344451c83f4184ef46d4e9906b94abda08836df

commit_message:
Fail if non-existent security group referenced

When using AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup resources with nova-network (not
Neutron), if a SourceSecurityGroupName was specified in a rule but the
name did not correspond to an extant security group it would be silently
ignored. This change ensures that any such error in the template will cause
creation of the security group to fail.

Closes-bug: #1291091
(cherry picked from commit 8ce9a177c47b3ee224200690d7181c784c418292)

Change-Id: I9344451c83f4184ef46d4e9906b94abda08836df
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/59/81559/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: test_template_nova_bad_source_group = ''' HeatTemplateFormatVersion: '2012-12-12' Resources: the_sg: Type: AWS::EC2::SecurityGroup Properties: GroupDescription: HTTP and SSH access SecurityGroupIngress: - IpProtocol: tcp FromPort: "22" ToPort: "22" CidrIp: 0.0.0.0/0 - IpProtocol: tcp FromPort : "80" ToPort : "80" CidrIp : 0.0.0.0/0 - IpProtocol: tcp SourceSecurityGroupName: thisdoesnotexist - IpProtocol: icmp SourceSecurityGroupId: "1" ''' def test_security_group_nova_bad_source_group(self): #create script clients.OpenStackClients.nova('compute').AndReturn(self.fc) nova_sg.SecurityGroupManager.list().AndReturn([NovaSG( id=1, name='test', description='FAKE_SECURITY_GROUP', rules=[], )]) clients.OpenStackClients.nova('compute').AndReturn(self.fc) sg_name = utils.PhysName('test_stack', 'the_sg') nova_sg.SecurityGroupManager.create( sg_name, 'HTTP and SSH access').AndReturn(NovaSG( id=2, name=sg_name, description='HTTP and SSH access', rules=[])) clients.OpenStackClients.nova('compute').AndReturn(self.fc) nova_sgr.SecurityGroupRuleManager.create( 2, 'tcp', '22', '22', '0.0.0.0/0', None).AndReturn(None) nova_sgr.SecurityGroupRuleManager.create( 2, 'tcp', '80', '80', '0.0.0.0/0', None).AndReturn(None) # delete script clients.OpenStackClients.nova('compute').AndReturn(self.fc) nova_sg.SecurityGroupManager.get(2).AndReturn(NovaSG( id=2, name=sg_name, description='HTTP and SSH access', rules=[{ "from_port": '22', "group": {}, "ip_protocol": "tcp", "to_port": '22', "parent_group_id": 2, "ip_range": { "cidr": "0.0.0.0/0" }, 'id': 130 }, { 'from_port': '80', 'group': {}, 'ip_protocol': 'tcp', 'to_port': '80', 'parent_group_id': 2, 'ip_range': { 'cidr': '0.0.0.0/0' }, 'id': 131 }] )) clients.OpenStackClients.nova('compute').AndReturn(self.fc) nova_sgr.SecurityGroupRuleManager.delete(130).AndReturn(None) clients.OpenStackClients.nova('compute').AndReturn(self.fc) nova_sgr.SecurityGroupRuleManager.delete(131).AndReturn(None) clients.OpenStackClients.nova('compute').AndReturn(self.fc) nova_sg.SecurityGroupManager.delete(2).AndReturn(None) self.m.ReplayAll() stack = self.create_stack(self.test_template_nova_bad_source_group) sg = stack['the_sg'] self.assertRaises(resource.UpdateReplace, sg.handle_update, {}, {}, {}) self.assertEqual(sg.status, sg.FAILED) stack.delete() self.m.VerifyAll() @utils.stack_delete_after

commit_message:
Segment LUN clones in NetApp iSCSI

The NetApp ZAPI for clone_create and clone_start has a maximum size.
This fix breaks the lun into consumable sizes for the ZAPI.

Closes-Bug: 1284182
Closes-Bug: 1296881
Closes-Bug: 1288962
Change-Id: Id4d0872c6099b7cfc73d806d772a3ae051a76b70
(cherry picked from commit af4a58d672cfa0c4b63015e7e783461570296c76)

commit_message:
Specify lld in tgt config backends

Otherwise when running tgt-admin --delete, it might forget
to invoke tgtadmn with "--lld iscsi" in order to delete the low-level
iscsi exports, which can cause crashes or hangs later on.

Closes-Bug: #1311640
Change-Id: I436c67c30565089236e987d84ac2609eedd2d2c7
(cherry picked from commit 872b7ca0fc5ce4911fdaadee464d46be5a38058d)

commit_message:
Don't expect nova-network is up if Neutron is used

If we use Neutron as network provider for OpenStack
cloud, nova-network service is not enabled on compute
nodes, so we should expect 14 Nova services are running
instead of 16.

Change-Id: Ie929d1c1f46dc11000c1b06469dafa5c8aaed330
Closes-bug: #1372056

commit_message:
Change open(file) to with block

Currently script which loads metadata definitions to database
uses open(file) to stream files. This isn't the best practice
because in case of any errors this code may not be safe.
To solve this problem this patch changes open(file) to
'with open(file) as...:' block. It allows us to ensure that every
resource is cleaned up when the code finishes running.

Change-Id: I4a85700061ed5050f4356f1b39ea128931626c83
Closes-Bug: #1367172
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/41/120041/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: with open(file) as json_file: metadata = json.load(json_file)

commit_message:
Netapp: set HTTP Authorization header to avoid 401 response

NetApp drivers (cmode, 7mode, iseries) have to send requests twice
in order to perform an action.
The first request is always respond with "401 Unauthorized", the
second is the same with an "Authorization" header added.
This is due to urllib2 implementation.
This patch set the "Authorization" header at the first request.
Hence HTTP requests number is divided by 2.

Closes-Bug: #1370573

Change-Id: Ia49a49b5b65c92e4e7104960d36e84076213cc12
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/31/122731/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Disable deploy some releases

In order to force customers moving to new releases or for technical
reasons we want to forbid deploying some releases. For this reason we
need to introduce a special field in the Relases model.

Please note, the field has no affect in experimental mode.

Change-Id: Iaf315d291ce9f18ad52b15c030be193d0d5ea6f9
Closes-Bug: #1368100

commit_message:
labs: update CirrOS image from 0.3.2 to 0.3.3

Update CirrOS image from 0.3.2 to 0.3.3. The reason for updating now is
that 0.3.3 allows setting the MTU via DHCP. Without that feature, users
would have to lower the MTU manually from the instance VM's VNC console.

Change-Id: Iee7530cb41e2a85af4a939fa004ac9e3546b6339

Sync glance docs with metadefs api changes

 - Rename resource_type to resource_type_
   associations in namespace API input/output
 - Add created_at/updated_at in resource_
   type_associations block of namespace API
   input/output.
 - Fix minor nits

Closes-bug: 1367908

commit_message:
Enforce using six.text_type() over unicode()

For python 3 compatibility, this adds a hacking check to prevent the
usage of unicode().

Change-Id: I791bbf251ac0f9615a9bedc2dd295a7982d72e0a
Closes-bug: #1282893
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/03/122203/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Replaces assertEqual with assertTrue and assertFalse

In order to improve coding practices and be aligned to a standard,
self.assertEqual(...,True) statements where replaced with
self.assertTrue and self.assertFalse.

Change-Id: I4150a343493beae03d6f71c88e84f60d14fb60e1
Closes-Bug: #1230127

commit_message:
Add a CONTRIBUTING file

Stolen wholesale from the one used by Glance; except that I've tried to
be clearer that pull requests on Github aren't actively ignored, they're
just never going to be seen.

Change-Id: I60c1cdac28889e2bb2436ebc005b8cf0a978e688
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-incubator refs/changes/50/122350/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. include:: ../../CONTRIBUTING.rst

subject: Stop using intersphinx
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-13 07:38:15.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator/commit/cef1ef212f40ecd0051f4fba13dd5e233e84c9b4', 'message': "Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using intersphinx

Remove intersphinx from the docs build as it triggers network calls that
occasionally fail, and we don't really use intersphinx (links other
sphinx documents out on the internet)

This also removes the requirement for internet access during docs build.

This can cause docs jobs to fail if the project errors out on
warnings.

Change-Id: I71e941e2a639641a662a163c682eb86d51de42fb
Related-Bug: #1368910
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-incubator refs/changes/05/121305/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: extensions = ['sphinx.ext.autodoc',
deleted_lines: extensions = ['sphinx.ext.autodoc', 'sphinx.ext.intersphinx', # Example configuration for intersphinx: refer to the Python standard library. intersphinx_mapping = {'http://docs.python.org/': None}

subject: Enabling separated sample config file generation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-03 08:27:57.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/d76bd91118c7de0d6349e8aebbc9b71cffbe654a', 'message': 'Enabling separated sample config file generation

As a common approach most projects used now and Oslo preferred, this
change enabled sample configuration file generation mechanism for
each Glance services.

This change, as an enhancement, allows generating separated sample
configuration files for each Glance major services, e.g.:

    etc/glance-api.conf.sample
    etc/glance-cache.conf.sample
    etc/glance-manage.conf.sample
    etc/glance-registry.conf.sample
    etc/glance-scrubber.conf.sample

It is different than I94d486d6686815c45705a7a9b00fb26062e1eb63
which only supports generating an unified sample configuration
file to including all Glance available options.

This mechanism  not only can help auditing by packager, milestone
maintainer or developer as a function (testenv) of tox, but also
those separated configuration files could make deployment be easy.
And it helps keeping sample configuration files be update with
code change.

The change added "genconfigs" function as a tox testenv (-egenconfigs),
and it dependes on oslo-config-generator function of oslo.config.

The change doesn't introduce those sample files Glance repo, so
next step is to investigate if we can generate them in gate
automatically when a change was merged.

Related-Change-Id: I15686708fc9460948a58cfea3d18dae40ba1fda9
Related-Change-Id: Iae31856d5886ee78786972d80c7c103c3460a2b3
Related-Change-Id: I76043b08e2872867e5af2a5ac902e4d092fda5c8
Closes-Bug: #1300546

Change-Id: Ibe03a3fe80b96ca32acb1a6bea7e38e6075951bb

    etc/glance-registry.conf.sample
    etc/glance-scrubber.conf.sample

It is different than I94d486d6686815c45705a7a9b00fb26062e1eb63
which only supports generating an unified sample configuration
file to including all Glance available options.

This mechanism  not only can help auditing by packager, milestone
maintainer or developer as a function (testenv) of tox, but also
those separated configuration files could make deployment be easy.
And it helps keeping sample configuration files be update with
code change.

The change added "genconfigs" function as a tox testenv (-egenconfigs),
and it dependes on oslo-config-generator function of oslo.config.

The change doesn't introduce those sample files Glance repo, so
next step is to investigate if we can generate them in gate
automatically when a change was merged.

commit_message:
Enabling separated sample config file generation

As a common approach most projects used now and Oslo preferred, this
change enabled sample configuration file generation mechanism for
each Glance services.

This change, as an enhancement, allows generating separated sample
configuration files for each Glance major services, e.g.:

    etc/glance-api.conf.sample
    etc/glance-cache.conf.sample
    etc/glance-manage.conf.sample
    etc/glance-registry.conf.sample
    etc/glance-scrubber.conf.sample

It is different than I94d486d6686815c45705a7a9b00fb26062e1eb63
which only supports generating an unified sample configuration
file to including all Glance available options.

This mechanism  not only can help auditing by packager, milestone
maintainer or developer as a function (testenv) of tox, but also
those separated configuration files could make deployment be easy.
And it helps keeping sample configuration files be update with
code change.

The change added "genconfigs" function as a tox testenv (-egenconfigs),
and it dependes on oslo-config-generator function of oslo.config.

The change doesn't introduce those sample files Glance repo, so
next step is to investigate if we can generate them in gate
automatically when a change was merged.

Related-Change-Id: I15686708fc9460948a58cfea3d18dae40ba1fda9
Related-Change-Id: Iae31856d5886ee78786972d80c7c103c3460a2b3
Related-Change-Id: I76043b08e2872867e5af2a5ac902e4d092fda5c8
Closes-Bug: #1300546
Closes-Bug: #1361963

Change-Id: Ibe03a3fe80b96ca32acb1a6bea7e38e6075951bb
Signed-off-by: Zhi Yan Liu <zhiyanl@cn.ibm.com>

When not ' 'specified (the default) run the scrub operation ' 'once and then exits. When specified do not exit ' 'and run scrub on wakeup_time interval as ' 'specified in the config.')) ]

commit_message:
Fixing typo and improving docstring of find_domain

This should make it easier to understand the
purpose of find_domain - I believe the reason
for which find_resource wasn't enough was not
quite clear.

Change-Id: I6a1cdfa86f52401d95c6da2cd38d7c95a140b4a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/50/122850/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: If the user does not have permissions to access the v3 domain API, e.g., if the user is a project admin, assume that the domain given is the id rather than the name. This method is used by the project list command, so errors accessing the domain will be ignored and if the user has access to the project API, everything will work fine.
deleted_lines: If the user does not have permssions to access the v3 domain API, assume that domain given is the id rather than the name. This method is used by the project list command, so errors access the domain will be ignored and if the user has access to the project API, everything will work fine.

commit_message:
Delete baremetal resources in correct order

This de-randomizes the order in which baremetal resources are
deleted; foreign keys in Ironic end up requiring a certain order.

Change-Id: I3835e5e98a7520fa69157ac5d16f6d1292adb7b0
Closes-Bug: 1371755
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/32/122832/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jroll): resources must be deleted in a specific order, this list # defines the resource types to clean up, and the correct order. RESOURCE_TYPES = ['port', 'node', 'chassis'] cls.created_objects = {} for resource in RESOURCE_TYPES: cls.created_objects[obj_type] = set() for resource in RESOURCE_TYPES: uuids = cls.created_objects[resource]
deleted_lines: cls.created_objects = {'chassis': set(), 'port': set(), 'node': set()} for resource, uuids in cls.created_objects.iteritems():

commit_message:
Add run_cross_tests.sh script

Script `run_cross_tests.sh` can be used for running unit tests in
other projects using the current package's code.

Change-Id: Iad636216cd73d2eeb70448fda789c0ad9d579b3a
Related-Bug: #1367354

added_lines: script = tools/run_cross_tests.sh

Remove unused/mutable default args

Having mutable default args is a bad idea
(http://docs.python-guide.org/en/latest/writing/gotchas/#mutable-default-arguments).

commit_message:
fix memory leak for function _safe_log

In _safe_log it uses recursive closure. The gc can not free stack for
this recursive closure for cycle-reference. So cut down the cycle
to fix it.

Resolved-bug: #1365892
Change-Id: I05fbd7091b886344d76b172a5ad66d9225599d69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/24/119524/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: res = log_func(msg, _fix_passwords(copy.deepcopy(msg_data))) _fix_password = None return res

commit_message:
Add description for test_models_sync function

Add description of the diff list that is generated in
test_modes_sync function for readability reason.

Change-Id: I3ecaf2da5a22b1835e0c6604b59f9cd1874747de
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db refs/changes/04/116004/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: the test will fail, if the difference is not empty. The return format is a list of diff directives, each representing individual differences. Possible diff directives with their description: "add_table": description of the table from models "remove_table": description of the table from database "add_column": schema, table name, column description from models "remove_column": schema, table name, column description from database "add_index": description of the index from models "remove_index": description of the index from database "add_constraint": description of constraint from models "remove_constraint": description of constraint from database "modify_nullable": schema, table name, column name, { "existing_type": type of the column from database "existing_server_default": default value of the column from database }, nullable from database, nullable from models "modify_type": schema, table name, column name, { "existing_nullable": database nullable "existing_server_default": default value of the column from database }, database column type, type of the column from models "modify_default": schema, table name, column name, { "existing_nullable": database nullable "existing_type": type of the column from database }, connection column default value, default from models
deleted_lines: the test will fail, if the difference is not empty.

subject: libvirt: convert encrypted LVM test to avoid DB usage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-09-16 14:24:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/2754ab199e43944243e34d4bdfe81f82c211dd62', 'message': 'libvirt: convert encrypted LVM test to avoid DB usage

The EncryptedLvmTestCase test case was depending on the DB setup
for no purpose. This masked a bug whereby the test was relying
on the implicit import of nova.keymgr.conf_key_mgr config opts.
Explicitly import the config opt and remove DB setup. This
improves performance from 1.8s to 0.6s

Partial-bug: #1369516
Change-Id: Icd5c27b3ac6cab5a014fae65904bbbefb5343282
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-09-17 09:59:39.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/virt/libvirt/test_imagebackend.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/7a94100c715ce009ced04edb1500bf455a62362f', 'message': 'libvirt: convert encrypted LVM test to avoid DB usage

The EncryptedLvmTestCase test case was depending on the DB setup
for no purpose. This masked a bug whereby the test was relying
on the implicit import of nova.keymgr.conf_key_mgr config opts.
Explicitly import the config opt and remove DB setup. This
improves performance from 1.8s to 0.6s

Partial-bug: #1369516
Change-Id: Icd5c27b3ac6cab5a014fae65904bbbefb5343282
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: convert encrypted LVM test to avoid DB usage

The EncryptedLvmTestCase test case was depending on the DB setup
for no purpose. This masked a bug whereby the test was relying
on the implicit import of nova.keymgr.conf_key_mgr config opts.
Explicitly import the config opt and remove DB setup. This
improves performance from 1.8s to 0.6s

Partial-bug: #1369516
Change-Id: Icd5c27b3ac6cab5a014fae65904bbbefb5343282
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/66/121866/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: CONF.import_opt('fixed_key', 'nova.keymgr.conf_key_mgr', group='keymgr')class EncryptedLvmTestCase(_ImageTestCase, test.NoDBTestCase):

commit_message:
libvirt: convert test_dmcrypt to avoid DB usage

Nothing in the dmcrypt test case uses the DB, so it was
incurring the DB setup penalty for no gain. Switch to
use NoDBTestCase reducing time from 1.7s to 0.09s

Partial-bug: #1369516
Change-Id: Ifd4b919f60f48f691d83cedb6ce7ea18c98636ad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/65/121865/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add missing baremetal API tests

This adds some missing API test coverage for listing ports by
node id, node by instance uuid, node by chassis id, and listing
nodes by instance association status.  In addition to the required
client changes, this adds a common waiter for baremetal nodes which
can be leveraged in the future by the baremetal scenario tests.

Change-Id: I175da30516d697a2b3115353f405e0fe3e1ccc76

commit_message:
libvirt: convert test_blockinfo.py to avoid DB usage

Remove use of the flavour/instance DB access in the blockinfo
test case by using the Instance object instead. This speeds up
execution from approx 3 seconds to 0.3 seconds.

Partial-bug: #1369516
Change-Id: Ibb76ae64edf48012c3eddfe2eb656aa58bd198b1

commit_message:
Fix floating_ips_bulk unit test name

The unit test file name of floating_ips_bulk should be
test_floating_ips_bulk.py instead of test_floating_ip_bulk.py.

Also rename the unit test class name from 'FloatingIPBulk' to
'FloatingIpsBulk'.

Change-Id: I1d89b91083e5b567f56b27d71754a9806d668b63

commit_message:
Add list by user to shell

Adds "--user" as a search option to the list command.

Also since seach by tenant or user also needs all_tenants=1 add
this to the seach options automatically instead of making users
remember to add it

Change-Id: Icc828080b400aecdb320b721c569992677848cc6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/74/122474/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Use common code instead of novaclient.utils

Module `novaclient.utils` contains a lot of functions which are
presented in modules from common code.

* service_type -> novaclient.openstack.common.cliutils.service_type
* get_service_type -> novaclient.openstack.common.cliutils.get_service_type
* pretty_choice_list ->
      novaclient.openstack.common.cliutils.pretty_choice_list
* import_class -> oslo.utils.importutils.importclass
* HookableMixin -> novaclient.openstack.common.apiclient.base.HookableMixin

Change-Id: Ia6cac058da12c852d92f26875a66ae31cc4c63d4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/44/122744/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Add progress and cell_name into notifications

When the instance DB record is updated, we send notifications. To make
those more useful, I have added in cell_name and progress. These fields
where added after the initial notifications were added.

Change-Id: I3bc770e3b8f211c27e5e4aadd1819507d643cc75
Closes-Bug: #1366758
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/53/120053/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_payload_has_cell_name_empty(self): info = notifications.info_from_instance(self.context, self.instance, self.net_info, None) self.assertIn("cell_name", info) self.assertIsNone(self.instance['cell_name']) self.assertEqual("", info["cell_name"]) def test_payload_has_cell_name(self): self.instance['cell_name'] = "cell1" info = notifications.info_from_instance(self.context, self.instance, self.net_info, None) self.assertIn("cell_name", info) self.assertEqual("cell1", info["cell_name"]) def test_payload_has_progress_empty(self): info = notifications.info_from_instance(self.context, self.instance, self.net_info, None) self.assertIn("progress", info) self.assertIsNone(self.instance['progress']) self.assertEqual("", info["progress"]) def test_payload_has_progress(self): self.instance['progress'] = 50 info = notifications.info_from_instance(self.context, self.instance, self.net_info, None) self.assertIn("progress", info) self.assertEqual(50, info["progress"])

commit_message:
docs: Use linkcode instead of viewcode extension

Instead of viewcode extension that generates htmls from code
and links there we use linkcode extension that allows to add
links directly to git.openstack.org nicely highlighted sources.

commit_message:
(WIP) StateFlow pattern

Experiments for blueprint stateflow-pattern.

The pattern will be backed by DiGraph. Some interesting analysis will
be added to ensure all invariants are hold. Looks like we can't have
StateFlow in 'allways good' state -- sometimes you'll add transition
that break invariant, and then add another transition that puts
that puts everything back to good. We'll see how to express this in API.

As for engine side, the plan is to steal some ideas from
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87417/, but do everything completely
different because I very much hope to come up with something simpler
for graph action and analyzer.

I'll be grateful if someone comes up with good more or less real-life
examples for the pattern, what I have now is too artificial.

Change-Id: I885d50dbcff1a0ae90ac8d5984400357293e016a

added_lines: # -*- coding: utf-8 -*- # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from taskflow import exceptions as exc from taskflow.patterns import state_flow as sf from taskflow import retry from taskflow import test from taskflow.tests import utils def _task(name, provides=None, requires=None): return utils.ProvidesRequiresTask(name, provides, requires) class StateFlowTest(test.TestCase): def test_state_flow_starts_as_empty(self): f = sf.Flow('test') self.assertEqual(len(f), 0) self.assertEqual(list(f), []) self.assertEqual(list(f.iter_links()), []) self.assertEqual(f.requires, set()) self.assertEqual(f.provides, set()) expected = 'taskflow.patterns.state_flow.Flow: test; 0' self.assertEqual(str(f), expected) def test_state_flow_add_nothing(self): f = sf.Flow('test') result = f.add() self.assertIs(f, result) self.assertEqual(len(f), 0) def test_state_flow_one_task(self): f = sf.Flow('test') task = _task(name='task1', requires=['a', 'b'], provides=['c', 'd']) result = f.add(task) self.assertIs(f, result) self.assertEqual(len(f), 1) self.assertEqual(list(f), [task]) self.assertEqual(list(f.iter_links()), []) self.assertEqual(f.requires, set(['a', 'b'])) self.assertEqual(f.provides, set(['c', 'd'])) def test_state_flow_with_retry(self): ret = retry.AlwaysRevert(requires=['a'], provides=['b']) f = sf.Flow('test', ret) self.assertIs(f.retry, ret) self.assertEqual(ret.name, 'test_retry') self.assertEqual(f.requires, set(['a'])) self.assertEqual(f.provides, set(['b'])) def test_state_flow_one_transition(self): task1 = _task('t1') task2 = _task('t2') f = sf.Flow('test').add(task1, task2) f2 = f.on(task1, 'ev', task2) self.assertIs(f, f2) self.assertItemsEqual(f, [task1, task2]) self.assertItemsEqual(f.iter_links(), [ (task1, task2, {'manual': True, 'take_when': ['ev']}) ]) def test_state_flow_add_transition_twice(self): task1 = _task('t1') task2 = _task('t2') f = sf.Flow('test').add(task1, task2).on(task1, 'ev', task2) self.assertRaisesRegexp(ValueError, 'Transition.*already exists', f.on, task1, 'ev', task2)

commit_message:
Add a 'clear' method to the JobBoard class

It removes all jobs from the board.

Change-Id: Icc1fe8c88bffcc59039ac6270b3dae5ac547dddf
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/taskflow refs/changes/95/91495/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_posting_clear(self): with connect_close(self.board): # Add a job to the board self.board.post('test', p_utils.temporary_log_book()) self.client.flush() self.assertEqual(self.board.job_count, 1) # Clear the board, make sure it is empty self.board.clear() self.assertEqual(self.board.job_count, 0) # Make sure we can still use the board self.board.post('test', p_utils.temporary_log_book()) self.assertEqual(self.board.job_count, 1)

Add user.name to git config in tests

Apparently git wants the user.name set as well as user.email, so add
that to the fixture class.
